qas.question: What is the best know musical genre amongst the Tigrinya?
What is the Eritrean traditional instrument, the wata?

answers.text: a distant/rudimentary cousin of the violin

qas.question: Who is the most popular Eritrean singing artist?
What is Helen Meles noted for?

answers.text: her powerful voice and wide singing range

qas.question: Who, in Eritrea, have their own styles of music and  accompanying dance?
What is the stringed krar a distant cousin of?
Who is the most popular Italian artist in Eritrea?
What instrument did Abraham Afewerki play?
What instrument does Yemane Baria play?
What musical instrument does Ruth Abraha play?

context: Eritrea's <a4_0>ethnic groups<a4_0/> each have their own styles of music and accompanying dances. Amongst the Tigrinya, the best known traditional musical genre is the <a0_0>guaila<a0_0/>. Traditional instruments of Eritrean folk music include the stringed krar, kebero, <b9_0>begena<b9_0/>, <b7_0><b8_0>masenqo<b8_0/><b7_0/> and the wata (<a1_0>a distant/rudimentary cousin of the <b5_0>violin<b5_0/><a1_0/>). The most popular Eritrean artist is the Tigrinya singer <a2_0><b6_0>Helen Meles<b6_0/><a2_0/>, who is noted for <a3_0>her powerful voice and wide singing range<a3_0/>. Other prominent local musicians include the Kunama singer Dehab Faytinga, Ruth Abraha, Bereket Mengisteab, Yemane Baria, and the late Abraham Afewerki.
